summary: This is a service request record from SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions for the Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It documents a request to rebuild a RAID system, with the request initiated by Jeffrey McKenzie and assigned to Jeff Cranor and Justin Houston.

events.title: RAID System Service Request Created
events.description: A service request (SR #22855) is created for the Federal Bureau of Prisons at MCC New York to rebuild a failed RAID system.

events.title: Service Request Assignment Period
events.description: The service request for the RAID rebuild is assigned to Jeff Cranor, Justin Houston, and Jeff McKenzie for the period from February 28 to March 8, 2019.

Beltsville, MD 20705 (SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions office)
keyFacts: This document is a technical service request for the Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The request concerns rebuilding a RAID system (Serial Number 43144901, Product Type VISION) that had crashed.
The request was marked as a priority (P3), next-day, emergency request requiring a phone call the same day.
The service was managed by SigNet Technologies, part of Convergint Federal Solutions, under support contract #32765.
The primary contacts and technicians were Jeff McKenzie (requester), Jeff Cranor, and Justin Houston.
